title: (S.I. No.732 of 2003), Section 47 of the Solicitors Act 1954 (as substituted by
heading: 1. Citation and Commencement
text_raw:
1. Citation and Commencement 

(a) These Regulations may be cited as the Registered European 
Lawyers Qualifying Certificate (Application Fee) Regulations

title: (S.I. No.732 of 2003), Section 47 of the Solicitors Act 1954 (as substituted by
heading: 2. Definitions
text_raw:
2. Definitions 

(a) 

In these Regulations, unless the context otherwise requires: 

"Act of 1960" means the Solicitors (Amendment) Act 1960 
(No. 37 of 1960); 

"Act of 2015" means the Legal Services Regulation Act 2015 
(No. 65 of 2015); 

in accordance with 
the application 
“application” means 
Regulation 8 of the 2003 Regulations and the 2020 Regulations 
delivered to the Registrar by an applicant registered lawyer for a 
qualifying certificate, pursuant to these Regulations and shall 
include a completed Qualifying Certificate Application Form, 
full application fee and any information required to be provided 
to the Society pursuant to these Regulations; 

“application fee” means the total amount of fees payable in 
respect of any application for a qualifying certificate under the 
2003 Regulations and the 2020 Regulations, as set by the 
Society from time to time and includes where appropriate and 
the 
applicable, 
Compensation Fund pursuant to Section 22 of the Act of 1960, 
the contribution in respect of the Authority's Levy Fund under 
the Act of 2015, and other fees specified by the Schedule of 
these Regulations, and shall, where applicable, mean the fees 
payable under these Regulations; 

the registration fee, 

the contribution 

to 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 23rd December, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [693] 3 

“Lawyers’ Establishment Directive” means Directive 98/5/EC 
of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 February 
1998 (as amended). 

“qualifying certificate” has the meaning assigned to it by the 
2003 Regulations; 

"2003 Regulations" means 
the European Communities 
(Lawyers’ Establishment) Regulations 2003 (S.I. No.732 of 
2003) as amended by the European Communities (Lawyers’ 
Establishment) (Amendment) Regulations 2004 (S.I. No.752 of 
2004, S.I. No.96 of 2008 and S.I. No.46 of 2015). 

“2020 Regulations” means the Registered European Lawyers' 
Qualifying Certificate Regulations 2020. 

“2023 practice year” means the calendar year commencing on 
1 January 2023 and ending on 31 December 2023; 

(b) Other words and phrases in these Regulations shall have the 
meanings assigned to them by the Solicitors Acts 1954 - 2015, 
the Act of 2015, the Lawyers’ Establishment Directive, the 2003 
Regulations or the 2020 Regulations where the context so 
permits. 

(c) The Interpretation Act 2005 applies to the interpretation of these 
Regulations as it applies to the interpretation of an Act of the 
Oireachtas.

title: (S.I. No.732 of 2003), Section 47 of the Solicitors Act 1954 (as substituted by
heading: 3. The Application Fee
text_raw:
3. The Application Fee 

The application fee specified in the Schedule hereto shall be payable in 
respect of applications for qualifying certificates for the 2023 practice 
year. 

Signed on behalf of the Law Society of Ireland pursuant to Section 79 of the 
Solicitors Act 1954. 
 16 December 2022 

MAURA DERIVAN, 
 President of the Law Society of Ireland 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [693]
text_norm: 3 application fee application fee specified schedule hereto shall payable respect application qualifying certificate 2023 practice year signed behalf law society ireland pursuant section 79 solicitor act 1954 16 december 2022 maura derivan president law society ireland 4 693

title: (S.I. No.732 of 2003), Section 47 of the Solicitors Act 1954 (as substituted by
heading: within referred to
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

within referred to 

EURO 

(a) Registration Fee for the 2023 practice year payable to the 

1420 

Society on application for a qualifying certificate by an 
applicant registered lawyer admitted to the Register of 
Registered Lawyers for three years or more on 1 January 
2023: 

(b) Registration Fee for the 2023 practice year payable to the 

1150 

Society on application for a qualifying certificate by an 
applicant registered lawyer originally admitted to the 
Register of Registered Lawyers for less than three years 
on 1 January 2023: 

(c) Contribution to the Compensation Fund for the 2023 

700 

practice year payable to the Society on application for a 
qualifying certificate by an applicant registered lawyer: 

(d) Contribution to the Legal Services Regulatory Authority 
Levy Fund for the 2023 practice year payable to the 
Society on application for a qualifying certificate by an 
applicant registered lawyer. 

(e) 

(f) 

Fee payable to the Society on each application, pursuant 
to Section 17 of the Solicitors (Amendment) Act 1960, 
for a copy of an entry on File A, File B or File C: 

Fee payable to the Society on each application, pursuant 
to Regulation 10 of the 2020 Regulations, for the issue of 
a duplicate original qualifying certificate for the 2023 
practice year. 

320 

100 

50 

 
 
 
 
 
 [693] 5
